title: Jimmy Kimmel Roasts Matt Damon, Mel Gibson and Donald Trump in Oscars 2017 Opener
text:
Jimmy Kimmel packed a whole lot of delicious Hollywood snark into his opening monologue at the Oscars this evening. Taking the stage after Justin Timberlake's performance, Kimmel launched right into the roasting. "I really hope the other guys from NSYNC were watching that performance," he told Timberlake, "I think there's a really good chance they're gonna let you back in the band." The first POTUS mention came a couple of minutes into Kimmel's monologue: "I wanna say thank you to President Trump—remember last year when it seemed like the Oscars were racist?" Kimmel acknowledged that "the country is divided right now", and asked everyone watching to "take a minute to reach out to one person you disagree with, and have a positive considered conversation - not as liberals or conservatives, as Americans… if we all do that, we could make America great again."

"Black people saved NASA, and white people saved jazz—that's what you call progress!"
Right alongside that plea for unity, Kimmel subtly shaded the walking controversy that is Mel Gibson. "There's only one Braveheart in this room, and he's not gonna unite us either, okay?" Kimmel said. "Mel, you look great, think the Scientology is working."
